item.title: Just software things...
item.description: Books Smalltalk with Style Communicating Sequential Processes Many gems from the c2 wiki XP vs Standard definition of a Unit-test Extreme Version Control Test first design Mock Objects Law of Demeter Law of Demeter - revised Test data builder (Where the builder pattern came from) On Monads Functional Programming Immutable Objects and Garbage Collection Oaoo balances Yagni You Arent Gonna Need It Deprecation Refactor Code Deleting Party Double Dispatch Multiple Dispatch Two is an impossible number Do the simplest thing that could possibly work Specific and general problem solving Laziness Impatience Hubris Design Shield Wizards are lazy Deadly Gui Prototypes Stress Free Programming Refactor Mercilessly Six Thinking Hats Worst things first Spike solution You arent gonna need it Walking Skeleton Walking Skeleton / DevOps perspective Lisp Macros standard control constructs Loops for blackbelts How the strengths of Lisp facilitate building complex and flexible applications Lisp / Jazz / Aikido Extreme programming The basic advantage of XP is that the whole process is visible and accountable.
